item.title: PlayerisMember command doesn't work
item.dc:creator: @kiaz kiaz
item.description:
@kiaz wrote:

this first part just cycles through once it is being called
for (int a = 1; a < PlayerHandler.maxPlayers; a++) {

goes from
“int a = 1” throght to what eva is specifyed next “a < PlayerHandler.maxPlayers;”

a++ tells it to start counting from 1 to what eva value maxPlayers hold

if “PlayerHandler.players[a]” is a player it then will continue
if (PlayerHandler.players[a] != null) {

then it checks if that player has the username its tryin to find “The victem”
if(PlayerHandler.players[a].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(victem)){

also it doesnt mater weather it is in capitals or not code of this code “.equalsIgnoreCase()”

if the players username isnt the victem it will go look for the next valid player

once it has found the valid user wid the playername it will tell it to change the value of that playerISmember
PlayerHandler.players[a].playerIsMember = 1;

Read full topic

for (int a = 1; a < PlayerHandler.maxPlayers; a++) {
if (PlayerHandler.players[a] != null) {
if(PlayerHandler.players[a].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(victem)){
PlayerHandler.players[a].playerIsMember = 1;

}
}
}

item.title: PlayerisMember command doesn't work
item.dc:creator: @BlackBeast666 BlackBeast666
item.description:
@BlackBeast666 wrote:

Everytime I use this command I relogin and it didn’t work.

if (command.startsWith("membership") && playerRights >= 3) {
		String victem = command.substring(11);
		sendMessage("Player "+victem+" successfully got membership settings");

client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victem)];
c.playerIsMember = 1;
	}

What’s wrong?

Read full topic
